cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles WSW of Marco Island, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast (MS/AL coastline)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near the Mississippi-Alabama border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama-Florida border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Golden Beach to Bonita Beach FL, Craig Key to Ocean Reef (including Florida Bay), and Okaloosa-Walton County Line FL westward to east of Morgan City LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida Atlantic coast and Keys Monday, then central Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Alabama Tuesday–Wednesday
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds of 40–50 mph with higher gusts affected the port Monday morning and will diminish through the afternoon
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of South Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher amounts up to 6–8 inches possible, producing brief flash-flooding in low-lying areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible through Monday evening across South Florida, including the Port Everglades area
